Detailed Description

A managed object which stores settings and knows how to do the Sync In or Sync Out for a single Browfile.

Ixternalizers are stored in the managed object context of a BmxBk document and are related to the documents BmxBkConfig as internalizers objects or externalizers objects. An ixternalizer which can perform Sync In for a single Browfile is an internalizer. An ixternalizer which can perform Sync Out for a single Browfile is an externalizer.

Details which apply to both -internalize and -externalize. These methods create a temporary Browfile, and an Extore, which create a temporary exterMOC. When these methods are complete, all of these objects will be autoreleased. Therefore, the next time one of these methods is invoked, bookmarks will be read in from the external store from scratch, all over again. Merging and item adjustments are performed according to the values of the relevant attributes in the receiver. The receiver's owning BmxBk is found by sending -owner to the receiver's -managedObjectContext. Progress messages may be sent to the receiver's owning BmxBk.

Member Function Documentation

- (void) externalizeWithDeference: (BkmmDeference)  deference  

Reads out items from the receiver's owner, a BmxBk, to the external store indicated by the receiver's browfileIdentifier.

Returns after the the BmxBk's data is converted, but writing data out continues asynchronouslyin other thread(s).

If ultimately successful, sets the timestamp lastExternalized of the browfile indicated by the receiver's browfileIdentifier.  Otherwise, presents the error to the user.  (Either of these are performed by -[Extore finishWriteExternalInfo:], after returning to the main thread.)

More info in the class documentation.

Parameters:
deference The level of deference to use in case a nasty browser will not allow bookmarks to be written

- (BOOL) internalizeWithDeference: (BkmmDeference)  deference  

Reads in items from the external store, as indicated by the receiver's browfileIdentifier, to the receiver's owner, a BmxBk.

If successful, sets the timestamp lastInternalized of the browfile indicated by the receiver's browfileIdentifier.  Otherwise, presents the error to the user.

More info in the class documentation.

Parameters:
deference The level of deference to use in case a nasty browser will not allow bookmarks to be read
Returns:
YES if the operation completes successfully; otherwise NO.
